title: The most senior officer wounded in Afghan war to head new veterans' office
text:
A war veteran who was the most senior officer injured in combat in Afghanistan is to head the Government’s new Office for Veteran Affairs (OVA).

Colonel David Richmond who had to undergo three and a half years of operations after a bullet shattered his right thigh will lead efforts to improve veterans’ services in areas such as mental health, employment and housing.

He said that his own experience as a war veteran meant “I understand the struggles that some face.” A former commanding officer of 5th battalion The Royal Regiment of Scotland, he served in Iraq as well as Afghanistan and went on to become recovery director at Help for Heroes.
